iimog/rock-paper-scissors.name: Rock–Paper–Scissors
iimog/rock-paper-scissors.instructions: Rock–paper–scissors or Scissor-Paper-Rock, is a zero-sum hand game usually played between two people, in which each player simultaneously forms one of three shapes with an outstretched hand. These shapes are 'rock' (✊ a simple fist), 'paper' (✋ a flat hand), and 'scissors' (✌️ a fist with the index and middle fingers together forming a V). The game has only three possible outcomes other than a tie: a player who decides to play rock will beat another player who has chosen scissors ('rock crushes scissors') but will lose to one who has played paper ('paper covers rock'); a play of paper will lose to a play of scissors ('scissors cut paper'). If both players choose the same shape, the game is tied and is immediately replayed to break the tie. - Rock–paper–scissors. (2017, March 10). In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 15:15, April 3, 2017, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rock%E2%80%93paper%E2%80%93scissors&oldid=769516750

de.name: Schnick Schnack Schnuck
de.instructions: Nur Schere, Stein und Papier, kein Brunnen, keine Echse, kein Spock.

iimog/coin-toss.name: Coin Toss
iimog/coin-toss.instructions: Put a cup or a glas on a table 10cm from the edge. Take a small coin (e.g. a penny) into your flat hand. Now hit the edge of the table with your hand such that the penny lands in the glas. Ties are broken immediately by replaying until one player hits and the other does not (a slightly different modus is possible: like Elfmeterschiesen)

iimog/interception.name: Interception
iimog/interception.instructions: Somebody throws something and somebody catches something.

de.name: Mundfangen
de.instructions: Jemand schmeißt etwas, das jemand mit dem Mund auffängt

iimog/darts.name: Darts
iimog/darts.instructions: Each round is played by each player throwing three darts the higher sum wins.

de.instructions: Jeder Spieler wirft drei Darts, die höhere Summe gewinnt die Runde.

iimog/beer-pong.name: Beer Pong
iimog/beer-pong.instructions: Place ten empty cups at each end of a long table (in the shape of a triangle). The goal is to throw a ping-pong ball into one of the cups of your opponent. The ball has to be thrown from your end of the table (and has to hit the table once before falling into the cup). This cup is removed and the team wins if the opponent has no more cups.

de.name: Bier Pong
de.instructions: An beiden Enden eines langen Tisches werden je zehn leere Becher aufgestellt (in Form eines Dreiecks). Ziel ist es den Ball von der eigenen Seite aus (mit einmal aufkommen) in einen Becher des Gegners zu befördern. Dieser Becher wird aus dem Spiel genommen. Wer zuerst alle Becher des Gegners getroffen hat gewinnt.

iimog/penny-football.name: Penny Football
iimog/penny-football.instructions:
Penny football is a coin game played upon a table top. The aim of the game is for a player to score more goals than their opponent. The object of the game is to flick a coin through the other two coins. This is the way in which players move the ball up the table. If the coin falls off the table or fails to pass through the other two coins, it becomes the opposing player's ball and is placed near his end of the table. A player may continue to flick any of the three coins through the other two until he wishes to shoot. At this point, the opposing player holds out his pinky finger and his index finger and places them flat on the table, so that the middle two knuckles of his hand are flat with the table edge. The first player then shoots in any way he wishes, while still hitting a coin between the other two coins. If the coin touches the opponent's knuckles, this counts as a goal.

Source: Penny football. (2016, October 16). In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 13:24, April 27, 2017, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Penny_football&oldid=744587448

de.name: Münzfußball
de.instructions: Ziel des Spieles ist es, eine Münze in einer bestimmten Art und Weise in die Markierung des gegnerischen Tores zu schießen. Der durch Zufall bestimmte Beginner legt alle drei Münzen vor sein eigenes Tor und muss nun versuchen die mittlere Münze durch die beiden anderen in Richtung des Tores seines Gegners zu spielen. Bei jedem Spielzug muss dabei eine der Münzen durch die gedachte Verbindungslinie der beiden anderen bereits liegenden Münzen geschnippt werden. Es ist jeweils nur ein Versuch gestattet. In Tornähe versucht man dann, in das Tor des Gegners zu treffen. Man darf so lange weiterspielen, bis man entweder (1) eine der anderen Münzen berührt, (2) mit einer beliebigen Münze die Spielfeldbegrenzung überschritten hat, (3) es nicht gelingt, zwischen den beiden liegenden Münzen hindurch zu treffen oder (4) ein Tor erzielt hat. Tritt einer dieser Fälle ein, so ist der Mitspieler am Zug und darf nun seinerseits versuchen, erfolgreich zu sein. Die Runde endet nach dem ersten Treffer. Angepasst von: Seite „Englisch Fußball“. In: Wikipedia, Die freie Enzyklopädie. Bearbeitungsstand: 13. September 2016, 09:20 UTC. URL: https://de.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Englisch_Fu%C3%9Fball&oldid=157888993 (Abgerufen: 27. April 2017, 14:02 UTC)

iimog/pitcher.name: Hold the pitcher
iimog/pitcher.instructions: A player from each team holds a pitcher with the arm stretched sideways (90°). The one who can hold the pitcher longer wins (threshold: 80°) the round.

de.name: Krughalten
de.instructions: Ein Spieler aus jedem Team hält einen vollen Maßkrug mit seitlich ausgestrecktem Arm (90°). Wer ihn länger halten kann (mind. 80°) gewinnt die Runde.

iimog/quizoid.name: Quizoid
iimog/quizoid.instructions: Each player plays a round of quizoid classic. The higher score wins the round.

de.instructions: Jeder spielt eine Runde Quizoid Classic. Der mit der höheren Punktzahl gewinnt. Teammitglieder dürfen Tipps geben aber entscheiden muss der aktive Spieler.

iimog/tabu.name: Tabu
iimog/tabu.instructions: Describe a term without using it (or some related ones) faster than your opponent

de.instructions: Erkläre einen Begriff ohne ihn (oder einige ähnliche) zu verwenden und zwar schneller als dein Gegner

iimog/paint.name: Drawing
iimog/paint.instructions: Draw a term and make your team guess it faster than your opponent

de.name: Zeichnen
de.instructions: Zeichne einen Begriff. Dein Team muss ihn schneller erraten als das gegnerische Team ihren Begriff.

iimog/pantomime.name: Pantomime
iimog/pantomime.instructions: Explain a term via pantomime to your team. They have to guess it faster than the opposing team guesses their term.

de.instructions: Stelle einen Begriff pantomimisch dar. Dein Team muss ihn schneller erraten als das gegnerische Team ihren Begriff.

iimog/sausage.name: Sausage
iimog/sausage.instructions: Each team starts with a 500g sausage. For each round an arbitrary (non negative) slice of the sausage is handed in for weighing. The team who handed in more sausage wins the round but the given slice is out of the game.

de.name: Wurst
de.instructions: Zu Beginn erhält jedes Team eine 500g schwere Wurst. Für jede Runde schneidet ein Spieler aus jedem Team je eine belibig große Scheibe ab. Das Team mit der schwereren Scheibe gewinnt, aber die Scheiben werden aus dem Spiel genommen.

iimog/pushups.name: Push-ups
iimog/pushups.instructions: The one who makes more push-ups wins

de.name: Liegestützen
de.instructions: Derjenige der mehr Liegestützen schafft gewinnt die Runde.

iimog/wall-sitting.name: Wall Sitting
iimog/wall-sitting.instructions: The one who can sit longer at a wall (legs 90°) wins the round.

de.name: Wandsitzen
de.instructions: Wer länger an der Wand sitzen kann (Beine 90°) gewinnt die Runde.

iimog/snake.name: Snake
iimog/snake.instructions: Play the classic snake game on a mobile phone. More points = winner.

iimog/moelkky.name: Mölkky
iimog/moelkky.instructions: The players use a wooden pin (also called 'mölkky') to try to knock over wooden pins of almost similar dimensions with the throwing pin, which are marked with numbers from 1 to 12. The pins are initially placed in a tight group in an upright position 3–4 metres away from the throwing place, with the pins organized as follows: 1st row, 1/2; 2nd row, 3/10/4; 3rd row, 5/11/12/6; 4th row, 7/9/8. Knocking over one pin scores the amount of points marked on the pin. Knocking 2 or more pins scores the number of pins knocked over (e.g., knocking over 3 pins scores 3 points). A pin does not count if it is leaning on the mölkky or one of the numbered pins (it must be parallel to the ground to count). After each throw, the pins are stood up again in the exact location where they landed. The first one to reach exactly 50 points wins the game. Scoring more than 50 will be penalised by setting the player's score back to 25 points. A player will be eliminated from the game if they miss all of the target pins three times in a row. - Mölkky. (2017, May 25). In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 11:21, June 11, 2017, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=M%C3%B6lkky&oldid=782131094
